description: Master SAP MM fundamentals including Procurement Process, Inventory Management, Invoice Verification, and MM-FI Integration

slides.title: Welcome to SAP Materials Management
slides.content:
# SAP Materials Management (MM)

SAP MM handles the **complete procurement and inventory** lifecycle, from purchasing to warehouse management.

## What You Will Learn

- **Procurement Process** - Purchase requisitions to purchase orders
- **Inventory Management** - Stock, goods movements, valuation
- **Invoice Verification** - Processing vendor invoices
- **MM-FI Integration** - Connecting to finance

## MM Sub-Components

| Component | Function |
|-----------|----------|
| **Purchasing** | Procurement activities |
| **Inventory Mgmt** | Stock and movements |
| **Invoice Verification** | Vendor invoice processing |
| **Warehouse Mgmt** | Storage and logistics |

## Procurement to Pay Process

```
Purchase Requisition (ME51N)
        |
        v
Purchase Order (ME21N)
        |
        v
Goods Receipt (MIGO)
        |
        v
Invoice Verification (MIRO)
        |
        v
Payment (F110)
```

> **MM is the backbone** of supply chain management in SAP!

slides.title: Material Master Data
slides.content:
# Material Master Record

## What is Material Master?

The material master contains **all information** about materials that a company procures, produces, stores, and sells.

## Material Master Views

| View | Data Contains |
|------|---------------|
| **Basic Data** | Description, unit of measure |
| **Purchasing** | Purchasing group, vendor |
| **MRP** | Planning parameters |
| **Storage** | Warehouse, bin location |
| **Accounting** | Valuation, price control |
| **Costing** | Cost estimates |
| **Sales** | Sales organization data |

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MM01 | Create Material |
| MM02 | Change Material |
| MM03 | Display Material |
| MM60 | List of Materials |

## Material Types

| Type | Description | Example |
|------|-------------|--------|
| ROH | Raw Materials | Steel, plastic |
| HALB | Semi-Finished | Subassemblies |
| FERT | Finished Goods | End products |
| HIBE | Operating Supplies | Office supplies |
| NLAG | Non-Stock | Services |

## Material Number

- Can be numeric or alphanumeric
- Up to 18 characters
- Internal or external assignment

> **Complete material master** enables smooth operations!

slides.title: Purchasing Process Overview
slides.content:
# Purchasing in SAP MM

## Purchasing Organization Structure

```
Company Code
    |
    +-- Purchasing Organization
            |
            +-- Purchasing Group 1
            +-- Purchasing Group 2
```

## Purchase Requisition (ME51N)

### What It Is
An internal document requesting procurement of materials or services.

### Key Fields
- Material or text description
- Quantity
- Delivery date
- Plant
- Requisitioner

### Sources
- Manual creation
- MRP run
- Production order

## Purchase Order (ME21N)

### What It Is
A formal request to a vendor to supply materials or services.

### Key Fields
- Vendor
- Material/service
- Quantity and price
- Delivery date
- Terms and conditions

## PO Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| NB | Standard PO |
| FO | Framework Order |
| UB | Stock Transfer Order |
| NBS | Subcontracting |

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| ME51N | Create Purchase Requisition |
| ME21N | Create Purchase Order |
| ME23N | Display Purchase Order |
| ME2M | PO List by Material |

> **Proper purchasing** ensures timely material availability!

slides.title: Purchasing Check
slides.content: Test your purchasing knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which transaction code is used to create a Purchase Order?

slides.title: Goods Receipt Processing
slides.content:
# Goods Receipt (GR)

## What is Goods Receipt?

The process of receiving materials from a vendor and recording them in inventory.

## GR Transaction (MIGO)

### Key Fields
- Movement type (101 for GR from PO)
- Reference document (PO number)
- Material and quantity
- Storage location

### Movement Types for GR

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 101 | GR from PO |
| 103 | GR to blocked stock |
| 105 | GR for free goods |
| 107 | GR from production |

## GR Process Flow

```
Purchase Order
      |
      v
Goods Received at Dock
      |
      v
Quantity/Quality Check
      |
      v
MIGO - Post GR
      |
      v
Stock Updated + Accounting Entry
```

## Three-Way Match

```
PO Quantity: 100 units
GR Quantity: 100 units  <-- Must match
Invoice Qty: 100 units  <-- Must match
```

## GR/IR Account

```
Goods Receipt Posting:
  Dr: Inventory (Material)    $10,000
  Cr: GR/IR Account           $10,000

Invoice Posting:
  Dr: GR/IR Account           $10,000
  Cr: Vendor (AP)             $10,000
```

> **Accurate GR posting** is critical for inventory and finance!

slides.title: Inventory Management
slides.content:
# Inventory Management (IM)

## Stock Types

| Type | Description | Available? |
|------|-------------|------------|
| Unrestricted | Normal usable stock | Yes |
| Quality Inspection | Pending QA approval | No |
| Blocked | Not usable | No |
| Transit | In transportation | No |
| Consignment | Owned by vendor | Yes |

## Goods Movements

### Common Movement Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 101 | GR from purchase order |
| 102 | GR reversal |
| 201 | GI for cost center |
| 261 | GI for production order |
| 301 | Transfer posting plant to plant |
| 311 | Transfer SLOC to SLOC |
| 561 | Initial stock entry |

## Stock Overview (MMBE)

```
Material: RAW-001
Plant: 1000

Storage Loc | Unrestricted | Blocked | QI
------------|--------------|---------|----
0001        |    500 EA    |   20 EA | 50
0002        |    200 EA    |    0    |  0
------------|--------------|---------|----
Total Plant |    700 EA    |   20 EA | 50
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MIGO | Goods Movement |
| MMBE | Stock Overview |
| MB51 | Material Doc List |
| MB52 | Warehouse Stocks |

> **Real-time inventory visibility** enables better planning!

slides.title: Inventory Valuation
slides.content:
# Material Valuation

## Price Control Methods

### Standard Price (S)

- Fixed price for valuation
- Variance posted to price difference account
- Common for finished goods

```
Standard Price: $10/unit
PO Price: $12/unit
GR: 100 units

Inventory: 100 x $10 = $1,000
Price Diff: 100 x $2 = $200
```

### Moving Average Price (V)

- Weighted average of all receipts
- Price updates with each receipt
- Common for raw materials

```
Opening: 100 units @ $10 = $1,000
Receipt: 50 units @ $12 = $600

New Total: 150 units = $1,600
New MAP: $1,600/150 = $10.67/unit
```

## Valuation Area

| Level | Advantage |
|-------|----------|
| Plant | Different prices per location |
| Company Code | Same price across plants |

## Key Reports

| TCode | Report |
|-------|--------|
| MB5B | Stock on Posting Date |
| MB5L | Stock Valuation |
| MBBS | Stock Balance History |

## Period-End Inventory

```
LIFO Reserve
Lower of Cost or Market
Slow-Moving Analysis
```

> **Accurate valuation** is critical for financial reporting!

slides.title: Invoice Verification
slides.content:
# Logistics Invoice Verification (MIRO)

## What is Invoice Verification?

The process of recording and validating vendor invoices against purchase orders and goods receipts.

## MIRO Transaction

### Key Steps

1. Enter invoice date and amount
2. Reference PO or GR document
3. System proposes line items
4. Verify and adjust if needed
5. Simulate and post

### Invoice Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Invoice | Normal vendor bill |
| Credit Memo | Vendor credit |
| Subsequent Debit | Additional charge |
| Subsequent Credit | Price reduction |

## Three-Way Match Verification

```
Purchase Order:
  100 units @ $10 = $1,000

Goods Receipt:
  100 units received

Invoice:
  100 units @ $10 = $1,000

Result: MATCH - OK to post
```

## Variance Handling

| Variance | System Action |
|----------|---------------|
| Within tolerance | Auto-post |
| Above tolerance | Block invoice |
| Price variance | May create difference |

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MIRO | Enter Invoice |
| MIR4 | Display Invoice |
| MRBR | Release Blocked Invoices |
| MIR6 | Invoice Overview |

> **Proper invoice verification** prevents payment errors!

slides.title: Invoice Verification Quiz
slides.content: Test your invoice verification knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: What is the transaction code for entering a vendor invoice in MM?

slides.title: MM-FI Integration
slides.content:
# Integration of MM with Finance

## Automatic Account Determination

MM transactions automatically post to FI accounts based on configuration.

## GR/IR Account Flow

### Goods Receipt
```
Dr: Inventory Account      $10,000
Cr: GR/IR Clearing Account  $10,000
```

### Invoice Receipt
```
Dr: GR/IR Clearing Account  $10,000
Cr: Vendor Account          $10,000
```

### Result
GR/IR account clears to zero when matched.

## Account Determination Tables

| Movement | Accounts Used |
|----------|---------------|
| GR | Inventory, GR/IR |
| GI to Cost Center | Expense, Inventory |
| Transfer | Inventory (both) |
| Scrap | Loss, Inventory |

## Configuration Path

```
SPRO > Materials Management >
  Valuation and Account Assignment >
    Account Determination
```

## Key Tables

| Table | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| T030 | Standard Account Determination |
| OBYC | Transaction Keys |
| T156 | Movement Type Config |

## Reconciliation

```
MM Stock Value:    $500,000
FI Inventory GL:   $500,000
                   --------
Difference:              $0
```

> **Tight MM-FI integration** ensures consistent data!

slides.title: Vendor Master and Source Determination
slides.content:
# Vendor Management in MM

## Vendor Master Purchasing View

### Key Fields

| Field | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Order Currency | Default currency |
| Payment Terms | Standard terms |
| Incoterms | Delivery terms |
| Minimum Order Value | PO minimum |
| Purchasing Group | Responsibility |

## Source Determination

### Info Records (ME11)

Material-Vendor relationship:
- Specific prices
- Lead times
- Quantities

### Source List (ME01)

Approved vendors for material:
- Valid periods
- Fixed vendor
- Blocked vendors

### Quota Arrangement (MEQ1)

Distribute orders among vendors:

```
Material: RAW-001

Vendor A: 60% of orders
Vendor B: 30% of orders
Vendor C: 10% of orders
```

## Purchasing Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| ME11 | Create Info Record |
| ME01 | Create Source List |
| MEQ1 | Quota Arrangement |
| ME2M | POs by Material |
| ME2V | POs by Vendor |

## Vendor Evaluation

Score vendors on:
- Price
- Quality
- Delivery
- Service

> **Strategic sourcing** improves procurement efficiency!

slides.title: Physical Inventory
slides.content:
# Physical Inventory Management

## Why Physical Inventory?

- Legal requirement
- Verify book vs physical stock
- Identify discrepancies
- Adjust records

## Physical Inventory Process

```
1. Create Physical Inventory Doc (MI01)
        |
        v
2. Print Count Sheets (MI21)
        |
        v
3. Count Physical Stock
        |
        v
4. Enter Count Results (MI04)
        |
        v
5. Analyze Differences (MI20)
        |
        v
6. Post Differences (MI07)
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MI01 | Create PI Document |
| MI04 | Enter Count |
| MI07 | Post Differences |
| MI20 | Difference List |
| MI24 | PI Documents Display |

## Counting Methods

| Method | Frequency |
|--------|----------|
| Annual | Once per year |
| Cycle Counting | Regular intervals |
| Continuous | Ongoing sample counts |

## Posting Differences

```
Book Stock: 100 units
Physical Count: 95 units
Difference: -5 units

Posting:
  Cr: Inventory      $50 (5 x $10)
  Dr: Inv Adjustment  $50
```

> **Regular physical inventory** maintains stock accuracy!

slides.title: Material Requirements Planning
slides.content:
# MRP in SAP

## What is MRP?

Material Requirements Planning **calculates** what to procure or produce, when, and how much.

## MRP Process

```
Demand (Sales Orders, Forecasts)
        |
        v
MRP Run (MD01/MD02)
        |
        v
Planned Orders / Purchase Reqs
        |
        v
Conversion to POs / Prod Orders
```

## MRP Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| PD | MRP |
| VB | Reorder Point Planning |
| VV | Forecast-Based Planning |
| ND | No Planning |

## Key MRP Parameters

| Parameter | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| MRP Type | Planning method |
| Lot Size | How much to order |
| Safety Stock | Buffer quantity |
| Reorder Point | When to order |
| Lead Time | Procurement time |

## MRP Run (MD02)

```
Plant: 1000
MRP Type: NETCH (Net Change)
Create: Purchase Requisitions

Result:
  Material RAW-001: PR for 500 units
  Material RAW-002: PR for 200 units
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MD01 | MRP Run - All |
| MD02 | MRP Run - Single Material |
| MD04 | Stock/Requirements List |
| MD05 | MRP List |

> **MRP ensures materials** are available when needed!

slides.title: MRP Quiz
slides.content: Test your MRP knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: What transaction displays the stock/requirements list for a material?

slides.title: Contracts and Scheduling Agreements
slides.content:
# Outline Agreements

## What are Outline Agreements?

Long-term purchasing agreements with vendors for repeated procurement.

## Contract (ME31K)

### Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| MK | Quantity Contract |
| WK | Value Contract |

### Example Quantity Contract

```
Vendor: 100001
Material: RAW-001
Target Quantity: 10,000 units
Price: $10/unit
Validity: Jan 1 - Dec 31, 2024

Releases Created:
  - Jan: 1,000 units
  - Feb: 800 units
  - Mar: 1,200 units
  Remaining: 7,000 units
```

## Scheduling Agreement (ME31L)

### Features
- Delivery schedule included
- JIT delivery support
- Firm/trade-off zones

### Example

```
Vendor: 100001
Material: RAW-001

Delivery Schedule:
  Week 1: 500 units
  Week 2: 500 units
  Week 3: 750 units
  Week 4: 750 units
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| ME31K | Create Contract |
| ME31L | Create Scheduling Agreement |
| ME33K | Display Contract |
| ME38 | Create SA Schedule Lines |

## Release Orders

```
Contract 4600000001
  |
  +-- Release PO: 4500000010 (1,000 units)
  +-- Release PO: 4500000025 (800 units)
```

> **Outline agreements** provide procurement stability!

slides.title: Consignment and Subcontracting
slides.content:
# Special Procurement Types

## Consignment

### What Is It?
Vendor-owned stock at your location. You pay only when consumed.

### Process

```
1. Consignment Fill-Up (ME21N with Special Proc)
2. Goods Receipt to Consignment Stock (101 K)
3. Transfer to Own Stock when consumed (411 K)
4. Vendor invoiced for consumption
```

### Benefits
- No payment until use
- Reduced working capital
- Stock availability

## Subcontracting

### What Is It?
Send components to vendor who returns finished product.

### Process

```
1. Create Subcontracting PO (ME21N)
2. Provide Components to Vendor (541)
3. Receive Finished Goods (101)
4. Components consumed automatically
```

### Example

```
Subcontract Order:
  Receive: ABC Finished Product
  Provide:
    - Component X: 2 units
    - Component Y: 1 unit

Vendor Charge: Assembly labor only
```

## Movement Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 541 | Transfer to subcontractor |
| 543 | Consumption at subcontractor |
| 101 | GR subcontracted goods |

> **Special procurement** optimizes supply chain flexibility!

slides.title: Reporting in MM
slides.content:
# MM Reports and Analytics

## Purchasing Reports

| Report | TCode | Shows |
|--------|-------|-------|
| POs by Vendor | ME2V | Vendor purchases |
| POs by Material | ME2M | Material purchases |
| PR List | ME5A | Open requisitions |
| Contract Monitor | ME3M | Contract status |

## Inventory Reports

| Report | TCode | Shows |
|--------|-------|-------|
| Stock Overview | MMBE | Stock by location |
| Material Documents | MB51 | Movement history |
| Stock Value | MB5L | Valuation details |
| Slow Moving | MC46 | Aging analysis |

## Invoice Reports

| Report | TCode | Shows |
|--------|-------|-------|
| Parked Invoices | MIR6 | Pending invoices |
| Blocked Invoices | MRBR | Blocked for payment |
| GR/IR Balance | MB5S | Unmatched items |

## Analysis Reports

### Spend Analysis
```
Vendor A: $500,000 (40%)
Vendor B: $350,000 (28%)
Vendor C: $250,000 (20%)
Others:   $150,000 (12%)
```

### Price Variance
```
Material: RAW-001
PO Price: $10.00
Invoice:  $10.50
Variance: $0.50 (5%)
```

> **Regular reporting** enables better procurement decisions!

slides.title: MM Period-End Closing
slides.content:
# Month-End Activities in MM

## MM Closing Checklist

### 1. Complete Open Documents

```
- Post pending goods receipts
- Post pending invoices
- Clear GR/IR differences
```

### 2. Revaluation (MR21)

Adjust material prices if needed:

```
Material: RAW-001
Current Price: $10.00
New Price: $10.50

Stock: 1,000 units
Revaluation: $500
```

### 3. GR/IR Clearing (F.13)

Clear matched GR and IR:

```
GR: $10,000 (101)
IR: $10,000 (MIRO)

Result: GR/IR account cleared
```

### 4. Period Close (MMPV)

Close MM period and open new:

```
Close: Period 01/2024
Open: Period 02/2024
```

## Key Closing Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| MMPV | Close/Open Period |
| MR21 | Price Change |
| F.13 | Automatic Clearing |
| MB5S | GR/IR List |
| CKMM | Actual Costing |

## Period Control

```
Period 12: Closed to MM postings
Period 01: Open for current posting
Period 02: Future period (closed)
```

> **Timely closing** ensures accurate inventory valuation!

slides.title: MM Best Practices
slides.content:
# MM Best Practices

## Master Data Quality

### Material Master
- Complete all relevant views
- Maintain accurate lead times
- Regular master data review
- Proper unit of measure setup

### Vendor Master
- Current contact information
- Accurate payment terms
- Proper account assignment

## Procurement Efficiency

| Practice | Benefit |
|----------|--------|
| Use contracts | Volume discounts |
| Batch releases | Reduced PO count |
| Vendor evaluation | Quality improvement |
| Catalog purchasing | Faster ordering |

## Inventory Optimization

### ABC Analysis

```
A Items (20%): High value, tight control
B Items (30%): Medium value, moderate control
C Items (50%): Low value, simple control
```

### Safety Stock
- Balance service level vs. cost
- Consider lead time variability
- Regular review and adjustment

## Common Pitfalls

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| GR/IR imbalances | Regular reconciliation |
| Duplicate vendors | Vendor cleansing |
| Over-ordering | MRP tuning |
| Price discrepancies | Info record maintenance |

> **Following best practices** maximizes MM value!

slides.title: Period-End Quiz
slides.content: Test your period-end knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which transaction is used to close and open MM periods?

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You have completed the **SAP Materials Management** lesson!

## Key Concepts Mastered

### Material Master
- Multiple views for different functions
- Types: ROH, HALB, FERT
- Valuation: Standard vs Moving Average

### Procurement
- Purchase Requisitions (ME51N)
- Purchase Orders (ME21N)
- Contracts and Scheduling Agreements

### Inventory
- Goods Movements (MIGO)
- Stock Types and Valuation
- Physical Inventory Process

### Invoice Verification
- Three-Way Matching
- MIRO for invoice entry
- GR/IR account clearing

### Integration
- Automatic FI postings
- Account determination
- Period-end closing

## Quick Reference

| Process | Key TCode |
|---------|----------|
| Create PO | ME21N |
| Goods Receipt | MIGO |
| Invoice Entry | MIRO |
| Stock Overview | MMBE |
| MRP Run | MD02 |
| Period Close | MMPV |

## What is Next?

Explore:
- SAP Integration scenarios
- Advanced procurement features
- Warehouse Management

> **You now understand** the core of SAP Materials Management!
